xuiEllipsis
directive in module xui

Description

XUI Ellipsis directive wraps text of its target and create ellipsis effect if text is larger then it's parent element.

Usage

as attribute
<ANY xui-ellipsis
     [is-ellipsis-enabled="{boolean}"]
     [append-to-body="{boolean}"]
     [find-parent-class="{boolean | string}"]
     ellipsis-options="{xui.IEllipsisOptions}">
   ...
</ANY>

Parameters

ParamTypeDetails
is-ellipsis-enabled
(optional)
boolean

Flag for turning tooltip on/off from outer controller.

append-to-body
(optional)
boolean

If set to true the ellipsis element will be appended at the end of the HTML body element. If false, default value, it will be appended to the actual ellipsis element. NOTE: When using ellipsis in widgets, set this to true.

find-parent-class
(optional)
boolean string

Flag for turning calculation based on Parent element width.
IMPORTANT! you need to define parent element by class .ellipsis-parent-full-width. Usually we put this class on element that has set fixed width (like container).
If you get into trouble (probably you trying to nest more ellipsis) you can specify what's the name of parent class, instead of find-parent-class="true",
you can use<div class="my-class-name">..<span ellipsis find-parent-class="my-class-name"></span>..</div>

ellipsis-optionsxui.IEllipsisOptions

Object width currently available parameters:

PropertyTypeDetails
tooltipTextstring

Full text for tooltip usage.

(default: '')

tooltipOptions
(optional)
IEllipsisTooltipOptions

List of options for our tooltip.

(default: {})

htmlBindTemplate
(optional)
string

For using ng-bind-html. Note: When using with string inside, use template string like in example vm.title | xuiHighlight:"HTML"

(default: '')
